intro: Fleischmannia yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan cholla, is a spiny, cactus-like plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula. It features a branching structure with cylindrical stems covered in sharp, tubercles. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers during the dry season, which are followed by small, fleshy fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, storing water in its succulent stems. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
